page.title: 09 Great Haseley School
page.content:
Haseley has had a school since about 1000.In 1647 Luke Taylor left money to it and in 1750 Thomas Blackhall left further money.This endowment became known as the Taylor/Blackhall Trust and still exists today. The original school was for boys only and the Rector was the schoolmaster. The oldest surviving part of the school is the stone-built dining room. The infants room was once the village institute or Club. In 1930 Haseley became a senior Central School and continued as an all-age school until 1957 when senior pupils transferred to the new secondary school at Wheatley. Haseley has continued as a primary school to the present time and now has 40 pupils and two teachers.
by G.L.Walker.
